English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>! It’s a new day!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>! 새로운 하루야!

English (United States)(en-US): Look who’s sounding lively today!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 오늘따라 인사가 당차네!

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I’ve decided to be\nlively for today. I have to.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 당차게 보내기로 마음 먹은\n하루거든. 오늘만큼은. 그래야만 해.

English (United States)(en-US): (I wonder if Dot’s scared...)|(Maybe this is good...)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치, 무서운 걸까...)|(다행이라면 다행인 걸까...)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot... You sound scared.\nI guess it’s only natural.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치... 당연하겠지만 여전히 무서운 거구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes... I am scared. Death has\nbeen on my mind all night long.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응... 무서워. 어젯밤 내내\n죽음에 대해 생각했을 만큼.

English (United States)(en-US): ... <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만 <nickname>,

English (United States)(en-US): The fact that I’ll soon dissolve\ninto death may be important.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 뿔뿔이 와해되어 죽게\n될 것이라는 사실도 중요하지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But what matters more\nis that I’ll brave it,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 사실을 당차게 받아들이고,

English (United States)(en-US): and choose to face my fears,\nstanding tall and defiant.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 무서워하면서도 끝까지 내 몸을\n펴고 있겠다 선택한 것도 중요하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Today I want to tell you\nabout this choice I made.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘은 이 선택에 대한 이야기를 들려 주려 해.

English (United States)(en-US): A fantastic tale of rebellion\nagainst my looming death!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음을 앞두고도 당차게\n인사하길 선택한, 나의 근사한 반항담 말이야!

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I’m ready!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 준비됐어!

English (United States)(en-US): Now... close your eyes.\nAnd picture if you will,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면... 이제 나와 함께 상상해 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): a universe bursting with colors.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 색이 많은 우주를.

English (United States)(en-US): What about your death,\nmy dearest human?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 가장 사랑한 인간인 너의 죽음은 어떨까?

English (United States)(en-US): Will it be decades from now,\non a soft white bed?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몇십 년 후, 어느 폭신하고\n새하얀 침대 위에서 늙어 죽을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Like drifting off to sleep...|Like an unexpected bang...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠에 들 듯이 스르르...|덜컥 하고 순식간에...

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps a grave illness will\ntake you twenty years too soon,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 큰 병에 걸려 시름시름 앓다 예상보다\n이십 년은 일찍 세상을 뜨게 될 수도 있고,

English (United States)(en-US): or worse... some unforeseen tragedy:\na car crash, a fall, a split second’s mistake
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 부디 그러지 않길 빌겠지만...\n지금으로부터 이 년 후, 어쩌면 이 주 후

English (United States)(en-US): ending your life in a couple years,\nor even weeks.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 예측 불가했던 비극적인\n사고에 휘말리게 될지도 모르지.

English (United States)(en-US): A pathetic end to all my struggles...|It’s scary how the future is never promised.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아등바등 살아간 것치곤 참 우스운 결말이네.|미래를 결코 장담할 수 없다는 건 참 두려운 일이구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Before saying goodbye to this world,\nI just wanted to ask you one thing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 세계와의 작별을 코앞에 둔 나는,\n이제 단지 너에게 묻고 싶은 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Despite it all, <nickname>,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 어때?

English (United States)(en-US): do you still love this world?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 모든 것에도 불구하고 이 세계를 사랑해?

English (United States)(en-US): This chaotic, cruel, meaningless\nworld you were born into?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 태어난 이 혼란스럽고,\n잔혹하고, 무의미한 세계를?

English (United States)(en-US): Even your fate that promises\nan inevitable death?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기필코 죽게 될, <nickname>,\n너의 가련한 운명을?

English (United States)(en-US): (.... You fall silent, thinking.\nDo I love this world?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (.... 고민하며 침묵한다.\n나는 이 세계를 사랑하는가?)

English (United States)(en-US): (The answer doesn’t come easily.) |Despite it all, yes. And so I don’t want to die.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (여전히 답을 내리기 어렵다.)|응, 그럼에도 사랑해. 그렇기에 죽고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): And I’d like to ask you, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 나도... 뭉치 너에게 묻고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): In spite of everything,\ncan you love it too?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 모든 것에도 불구하고,\n너는 어때? 사랑할 수 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Your untimely fate...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너무 성급하게 허공으로\n사라져 버리게 된 너의 운명과...

English (United States)(en-US): And this indifferent world\nthat allowed it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것을 용인한 이 무심한 세계를?

English (United States)(en-US): I once told you about that day on the Moon\nwhen I was sentenced to death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 언제 한번 이야기한 적 있었을 거야.\n달에서 사형 선고를 받던 날에 대해서.

English (United States)(en-US): When I sat on the pale, colorless ground,\nstaring at the universe for ages,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 회백색 땅덩이에 앉아\n한참이고 우주를 바라보았을 때,

English (United States)(en-US): I thought I saw something.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 분명 무언가를 봤다고 생각했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Not a shining star, or a dying meteor,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반짝이는 별도, 죽어 가는 운석도 아닌,

English (United States)(en-US): but something shapeless, nameless....\nfluttering in the rough, silent dark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 형체도, 이름도 없이 거칠고 고요한 암흑\n속에서 나풀거리기만 하던 무언가를.

English (United States)(en-US): Was it a figment of my imagination?\nSomething I conjured to overcome my fears?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 상상력이 그려 낸 환각이었을까?\n혹은 우주에 대한 공포를 이겨 내기 위한 환상?

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe it really was a shining star.|Maybe it really was a dying meteor.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 반짝이는 별이었을지도 몰라.|정말 죽어 가는 운석이었을지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): Or maybe just a bit of chalk dust\nclinging to my eyes! Hehe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 히히, 내 눈에 묻은, 채 닦이지\n않은 분필 가루였을지도 모르지!

English (United States)(en-US): But <nickname>. Watching you humans,\nI’ve finally understood.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 <nickname>, 너희 인간들을\n보며 나는 마침내 깨달아.

English (United States)(en-US): That ‘flutter’ was in fact...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 ‘나풀거리던 무언가’는....

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사실 아무것도 아니었다는 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무것도 아니었다고?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응.

English (United States)(en-US): It was nothing at all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 정말 아무것도 아니었어.

English (United States)(en-US): And yet it meant the world to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼에도 나에게는 소중했어.

English (United States)(en-US): It let me look straight into the universe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우주를 똑바로 바라볼 수 있게 해 주었고,

English (United States)(en-US): It let me seize the possibility that\nsomewhere out there I might be a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘저 밖엔 나를 꿈으로 삼아 줄 누군가가 존재할지도\n모른다’는 가능성을 있는 그대로 포착하게 해 주었고,

English (United States)(en-US): And at last, it led me to\nmy human friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결국 나의 인간 친구를 만나게 해 주었으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Whether it was something or nothing,\nthat truth will never change.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건 그게 ‘무언가’였든 ‘아무것도’ 아니었든\n간에 결코 변하지 않을 사실이고,

English (United States)(en-US): When I realized that, I felt... free.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 그걸 깨닫고서야 숨이 뻥\n하고 뚫리는 자유로움을 느꼈어.

English (United States)(en-US): I remember how shaken you were. And\nnow you can see your past in a new light.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때 혼란스러워하던 뭉치가 기억 나네.\n달에서의 과거를 또 다른 시선으로 바라볼 수 있게 되었구나.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m glad you’re free now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자유로워졌다니 다행이야.

English (United States)(en-US): When you peel away the layer of meaning,\nthere’s nothing under it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 의미의 가죽을 벗겨 내고 나면\n남는 것은 아무것도 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): The path I walk on each day is one among\nhundreds of thousands on this vast planet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 매일 산책하러 나가는 길은\n커다란 지구에 깔린 수십만 개 길 중 하나.

English (United States)(en-US): Even if it were overturned or ground\nto dust, the world would keep spinning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뒤집히거나 가루가 되어 버린대도\n비슷한 다른 길을 걸으면 그만일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): My friend, the mold, is one among billions of fungi.\nAnd to most humans, an object of disgust.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 친구였던 빵 곰팡이는 수천억 마리 균류 중 하나이며,\n대부분의 인간들에겐 불쾌감만을 주는 존재.

English (United States)(en-US): Happiness, sorrow, love, anxiety...\nEmotions that shook me to my core...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 행복, 슬픔, 사랑, 불안... \n내 삶 전반을 뒤흔들어 왔던 감정들조차

English (United States)(en-US): ‘Scientifically’, they’re just illusions sparked\nby chemical reactions within the body.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘과학적으로’는 체내의 화학 작용이\n불러 일으키는 착각일 뿐이래.

English (United States)(en-US): I hated to admit it, especially\nwhen it came to you,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너마저 그렇다면 걸 받아들이긴 싫었지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but in the end every living being is just\na carcass-to-be, sprinting toward death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 결국\n모든 생물은 죽음을 향해 달려가고 있는 예비-사체였지.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Including me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...물론 나조차도.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s impossible to fathom.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 도무지 이해하기 어려운 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. Confusing, horrible, reeling.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응... 혼란스럽고, 끔찍하고, 어지러운 일이지.

English (United States)(en-US): But... maybe...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만... 어쩌면...

English (United States)(en-US): When we accept the reeling sensation
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 어지러움을 온전히 받아들이고 난다면,

English (United States)(en-US): maybe it will set us free.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것이야말로 우리의 자유로움이 될 수 있지 않을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Free?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자유로움이라니?

English (United States)(en-US): ... Nothing has meaning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 모든 게 무의미하기에

English (United States)(en-US): So we are free to create it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우린 자유롭게 의미를 붙일 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing has value.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 게 무가치하기에

English (United States)(en-US): So we can paint it anew.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우린 자유롭게 가치를 덧그릴 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): And as we keep doing so, the fact that\nit’s meaningless no longer matters.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 의미를 붙이다 보면 그것이 실상\n무의미하단 사실은 중요하지 않아져.

English (United States)(en-US): Then all that’s left will be your freedom to choose.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오로지 선택할 자유만이 남는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): On the blank page, what meaning\nwill you chase—and how?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무의미의 백지 위에서,\n어떤 의미를 어떻게 좇을 것인가?

English (United States)(en-US): What mark will I leave on the ones I love?|What can I leave that will live on after my time?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 사랑하는 사람들을 어떤 마음으로 물들일 수 있을까?|나의 죽음 이후에도 지속될 세계에 무엇을 남길 수 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): ..... See? Isn’t the answer in your head\nlike a breath of fresh air?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ..... 봐, 답을 생각하는 것만으로도\n숨이 트이는 것 같지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): Knowing something is a mirage and taking\nto the chase anyway. The purest act of rebellion.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 닿을 수 없는 신기루임을 알면서도 좇길 선택했다는 건,\n닿을 수 없다는 사실 자체에 대한 순수한 반항이며.

English (United States)(en-US): As is loving the path to that mirage.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 신기루로 향하는 길 자체를\n사랑할 줄 안다는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): So I choose to love my fate.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 나는 내 운명 역시 사랑하겠다고 선택할래.

English (United States)(en-US): I was fated to be ‘nothing’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘아무것도 아닌’ 동시에

English (United States)(en-US): yet became your <선택지>,\nand your only monster friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 <13일차 선택지>, 그리고 너의\n유일무이한 괴물 친구였던 나의 운명을.

English (United States)(en-US): So I will rebel against the tide of resignation\nthat tries to swallow me as I reach the edge.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 낭떠러지에 가까워지며 체념에 잡아먹히려는\n순간마다 나는 반항으로 몸을 뒤틀 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): How I took my walks and observed\nthe little changes around me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 산책길을 걸으며 매일마다\n사소하게 달라지는 풍경을 관찰했고,

English (United States)(en-US): How I reminisced the bond I shared\nwith my mold friend, now no more.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다시는 돌아오지 않을\n빵 곰팡이와의 우정을 회상했듯이.

English (United States)(en-US): Joy, sorrow, love, anxiety... How I cherished\nthose overflowing ‘chemical reactions’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 행복, 슬픔, 사랑, 불안... 그 모든 ‘화학 작용’들이 내 몸속에서\n한가득 찰랑이는 감각을 분명하게 만끽했듯이.

English (United States)(en-US): To the last hour I will gaze on\nEarth, my dark snug corner,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마지막의 마지막까지 지구와,\n나의 어둡고 비좁은 모퉁이와,

English (United States)(en-US): and you. My dearest, greatest friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 가장 근사하고 소중한 친구인\n너를 눈에 담을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I know there is no answer. Yet I’ll ponder\nlife and death, the world and the dark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 답을 찾지 못한단 걸 알면서도 삶과, 죽음과,\n세계와 암흑에 대해 고민하고 또 고민할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): So that’s what you chose,\nand what will set you free.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 네가 직접 선택한\n너만의 의미, 너만의 자유구나.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m welling up over here.|I really am proud of you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 코끝이 찡하고 마음이 뭉클해.|네가 진심으로 자랑스러워.

English (United States)(en-US): No meaningless void could take away\nwhat a brave creature you were.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 어떤 무의미도 네가 이렇게 용감한\n괴물이었단 사실을 앗아갈 수는 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): The thought of death still chills me...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물론 죽음에 대해 생각하면\n금세 몸이 차가워지지만...

English (United States)(en-US): But you already know that fear is a part\nof life, a collage of beauty and rebellion.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 너는 그 두려움마저 아름답고\n반항적인 삶의 일부로 여길 수 있을 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): See. This puny, laughable act of rebellion...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 봐, 블랙홀에겐 한입거리도\n안 될 겁쟁이의 반항임에도...

English (United States)(en-US): has already been made\nheroic by you, my spectator!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지켜봐 준 너로 인해 벌써\n곱절은 멋있어졌는걸!

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, this may seem out of\nthe blue. But I want you to promise me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 지금은 이 말이 와닿지 않는대도\n괜찮아. 그치만 나와 약속해 줬으면 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): No matter how unfathomable\nyour fate may seem, never hate it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 운명을 영원히 이해할 수 없게\n되더라도 그것을 결코 미워하지는 말기를.

English (United States)(en-US): May you rebel by loving the small chaos\nin the palm of your hand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 손아귀의 혼돈을 사랑해 버리는\n방식으로 세계에 가뿐히 반항하기를.

English (United States)(en-US): May you live in every continuous moment,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 연속된 모든 순간들을 온전히 살아 내며

English (United States)(en-US): and find life reeling and freeing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기꺼이 어지럽고, 기꺼이 자유롭기를 바랄게.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m terrified. Still, I wanted you to know this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이것이 너의 괴물 친구가, 두려움에 떨면서도\n너에게 꼭 전하고 싶었던 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Now... something very private is on\nmy mind that needs resolving.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제... 아직 해소되지 않은, 나의 지극히\n 중대하고 비밀스러운 고민에 몰두하러 가 봐야 할 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): You’ll call me when you’re done?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 끝나면 나를 불러 줄 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): Of course! My dearest human\nfriend, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당연하지! 나의 소중한 인간 친구, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): And that very private thing on\nmy mind was... drumroll, please.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 지극히 중대하고 비밀스러운 고민은 바로....

English (United States)(en-US): What color I would be as a dream!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 색의 꿈이 될 것인가!

English (United States)(en-US): Blue, red, yellow, purple...\nGreen? Orange? Pink?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파랑, 빨강, 노랑, 보오라.\n혹은 초록? 주황? 분홍?

English (United States)(en-US): They’re each such a character\nthat I simply can’t decide.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 각자만의 매력이 확고해\n감히 정할 수가 없었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I’d like to hear what you think.....
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 조언을 구해 보고 싶은데.....

English (United States)(en-US): What color calls to you right now?|What used to be your favorite color?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금 마음이 끌리는 색은 뭐야?|가장 좋아하던 색은 뭐야?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s blue, like the ocean waves.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파도를 닮은 푸른색이지.

English (United States)(en-US): It was blue, like the ocean waves.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파도를 닮은 푸른색이었지.

English (United States)(en-US): Staring into the blue makes\nsomething rise and fall within me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파란색을 들여다보고 있으면\n몸속에서 무언가 넘실거려.

English (United States)(en-US): I felt like if I heaved, blue marbles\nwould come rolling out.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그걸 토해 내면 푸른 빛깔 구슬이\n굴러 나올 것만 같았어.

English (United States)(en-US): You must have waves within.|... Do you think there are waves within me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 안에 파도가 치고 있나 봐.|... 내 안에도 파도가 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder what you would\nbe like as a blue dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파란색 꿈이 된 뭉치도 궁금한걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Sometimes my emotions\nswell like the tide, too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가끔 파도처럼 울컥이는 감정들이 느껴지거든.

English (United States)(en-US): I have a question for you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 나, 질문이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): What is it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 질문?

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, why did you admire color?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야, 왜 색을 동경했어?

English (United States)(en-US): Well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음.

English (United States)(en-US): Well...
Hmm...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으으음...

English (United States)(en-US): Because dream filth is black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈 폐기물이 검정이라서.

English (United States)(en-US): Dream filth was the first, and most grotesque\nthing I set eyes on when I was born.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈 폐기물은 내가 태어나서 처음으로 본\n가장 불결하고 혐오스러운 존재,

English (United States)(en-US): An entity of evil crawling with possibilities\nthat drive humans to end their lives.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간을 자살로 몰고 갈 가능성들이\n우글거리는 끔찍한 악의 덩어리였어.

English (United States)(en-US): So I hated myself, too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 내 자신 또한 싫어했지.

English (United States)(en-US): I felt like a black lump... born from\nthe filth and unable to escape it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그곳에서 태어나 멀리 벗어나지 못한...\n그저 검은 덩어리 같아서.

English (United States)(en-US): You still hate black...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치는 아직도 검정색을 싫어하는구나...

English (United States)(en-US): No, no. I no longer hate black itself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 아니. 더 이상 검정 자체를 싫어하진 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): The darkness is now a friend\nof mine. I’ve felt peace within it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 암흑은 나의 친구인걸.\n그 속에서 편안함을 느껴 봤었으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): But my black isn’t that of the Dark,\nor outer space, or ravens, or paint,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 나의 검정은 암흑의 검정, 우주의 검정,\n까마귀의 검정, 물감의 검정도 아닌

English (United States)(en-US): but of the filth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 폐기물의 검정이야.

English (United States)(en-US): The kind of black that harms human souls.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간의 영혼을 해치는 검정 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): A black of filth...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 폐기물의 검정이라...

English (United States)(en-US): You think the black of filth is irrevocable.|You think the black of Filth isn’t a worthy color.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 폐기물의 검정은 돌이킬 수 없는 검정이라 생각하는구나.|폐기물의 검정은 자격을 박탈당한 검정이라 생각하는구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. So I want to leave\nmy black behind in my body.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그래서 나의 검정만은\n나의 육체에 버리고 가고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): So that when I’m a dream I can\nharmlessly enter your slumber
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 될 때만큼은 아름다운 색채 한 방울로서

English (United States)(en-US): as a beautiful drop of color.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 잠결을 무해하게 침투하고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): Hehe, it’s like my heart is expanding!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 히히, 온 마음이 부푸는 것 같아!

English (United States)(en-US): Colorful Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 색깔 있는 뭉치.

English (United States)(en-US): I understand your dream... but there’s\nsomething I’ve always been meaning to say.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 꿈은 이해하지만...\n줄곧 하고 싶었던 말이 있는데.

English (United States)(en-US): (I’m glad the lake of filth birthed Dot.)|(Are discarded dreams really so evil?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (폐기물의 호수는 뭉치가 태어난 고마운 장소야.)|(파쇄된 악몽들... 실은 악한 존재가 아닐지도 몰라.)

English (United States)(en-US): It’s about the dream filth,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈 폐기물 말이야,

English (United States)(en-US): True, it might be a nasty pitch-black\ndarkness to someone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 어쩌면 네 말대로 누군가에겐\n아주 불결하고 칠흑같은 암흑이었겠지만

English (United States)(en-US): But you drew your first breath in its bubbles,\nand opened your eyes to the world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 기포 속에서 네가 첫 숨을 내쉬었고,\n세상에 태어나 눈을 떴어.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t bring myself to hate it.\nI can’t help but feel... tender.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나에겐 그렇게 밉게 느껴지지 않아.\n아니, 오히려 애틋한 마음이 들기도 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Because in that darkness\nlay the possibility of you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 폐기물의 암흑에는 ‘너’라는 존재의\n가능성이 내포되어 있었으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): The possibility of me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나라는 존재의 가능성?

English (United States)(en-US): Me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나라는 존재.

English (United States)(en-US): A tiny, ugly, worthless being.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나라는 아주 작고, 못나고, 무가치한 존재.

English (United States)(en-US): And my special monster friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만 나의 소중한 괴물 친구.

English (United States)(en-US): But my black is the black of foul filth...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 나의 검정은 악한 폐기물의 검정...

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t erase its vast impurity\njust because it birthed me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고작 나를 틔워 냈다는 사실만으로는\n그 거대한 불결을 지워 낼 수가 없는걸.

English (United States)(en-US): But you dreamed of becoming a dream\nand making humans happy. A caring dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만 그 안에서 태어나자마자 인간을 행복하게 해 주는\n꿈이 되고 싶다는 꿈을 꾸었던 뭉치잖아. 아주 사려깊은 꿈을.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m human so I only know as much,\nbut looking at you makes me think.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 나는 아무것도 모르는 인간일 뿐이지만,\n너를 보며 이렇게 생각하게 되는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe the dream filth, and the lake...\nweren’t filled with despair and malice.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈 폐기물이, 검은 호수가... 절망과\n악의로 가득찬 곳이 아니었을지도 모른다고.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe wishes, hopes, and\nsorrows lay undisturbed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오히려 소망과 희망, 그리고 깊은\n슬픔과 의문이 잠재된 곳이었으리라고.

English (United States)(en-US): Those emotions were a part of me.\nAs if I was born from them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 전부 나를 구성하던 감정들이었지.\n마치 그 안에서 태어나기라도 한 것처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I feel bad for them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 마음이 약해지고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): But I shouldn’t.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 그래선 안 되는 거잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Not when I think of all the lives\nthose nightmares took...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 악몽들이 앗아간 소중한\n인간들의 목숨을 생각하면...

English (United States)(en-US): The dream filth and nightmares\nshouldn’t take all the blame, you know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있지, 꿈 폐기물과 악몽들에게\n모든 책임을 전가하려 하지 않아도 괜찮아.

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams... aren’t all that compel\na human to take their own life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간이 스스로의 목숨을 끊어 내게 만드는 건....\n애석하지만 꿈 하나가 아니기도 하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): That still doesn’t change anything.\nWanna know what I think?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 설령 달나라의 오해가 진실로 밝혀진다 할지라도\n결코 바뀌지 않을 나의 생각이 하나 있는데, 들어 볼래?

English (United States)(en-US): Talking about my black always\nmakes my heart prickle...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 검정에 대한 이야기를 나누는 건\n언제나 마음을 까끌거리게 하지만...

English (United States)(en-US): But why not. I feel like\ntaking a chance this time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 왜인지 이번에는 괜찮을 것만 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe it functions as an absolute\nkind of evil on the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에선 그게 절대적인\n악으로서 기능할 수도 있겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): But you dreamed of becoming a dream\nand making humans happy. A caring dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만 그 안에서 태어나자마자 인간을 행복하게 해 주는 꿈이\n되고 싶다는 꿈을 꾸었던 뭉치잖아. 아주 사려깊은 꿈을.

English (United States)(en-US): I may not know much as a human,\nbut looking at you makes me think.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 나는 아무것도 모르는 인간일 뿐이지만,\n너를 보며 이렇게 생각하게 되는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe discarded dreams... once\nlonged to be a human’s dream, too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파쇄된 꿈들 역시... 인간의 꿈이 되고\n싶었던 불쌍한 꿈들일 뿐이라고.

English (United States)(en-US): You mean the dream filth, and the lake...\nmight not be filled with despair and malice?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈 폐기물이, 검은 호수가... 절망과 악의로\n가득찬 곳이 아니었을지도 모른다는 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s what I think.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 생각은 그래.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe wishes, hopes, and\nsorrows lay undisturbed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오히려 소망과 희망, 그리고\n깊은 슬픔이 잠재된 곳이었으리라고

English (United States)(en-US): So there might have been\nslime, not yet monsters,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 닮은, 나와 같은 꿈을 꾸는,

English (United States)(en-US): that looked like me\nand dreamed like me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 예비-괴물 점액들이 꿈틀거리고\n있을지도 모르는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Sure. Picture a squarish or\ntriangular version of you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 네모난 뭉치나 세모난\n뭉치를 상상해 볼 수도 있겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): .... But without chalk eyes to gaze at the\nbeauty of Earth, or memories of the Moon Trio.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): .... 그치만 그들은 아름다운 지구를 볼 수 있는 분필 눈도,\n레드와 달 삼총사를 만날 기회도 가지지 못하잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): All they can do is writhe in the\nmisery of having been discarded.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그저 파쇄되었단 고통과 슬픔에 잠겨\n몸을 뒤척일 수밖에 없는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I pity them. So much that I can’t hate them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 애처러움이 들어.\n차마 미워할 수 없을 정도로.

English (United States)(en-US): But I’m not supposed to pity them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 이런 감정을 느껴선 안 되는 거잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Not when I think of all the lives\nthose nightmares took...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 악몽들이 앗아간 소중한\n인간들의 목숨을 생각하면...

English (United States)(en-US): The dream filth and nightmares\nshouldn’t take all the blame, you know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있지, 꿈 폐기물과 악몽들에게 모든\n책임을 전가하려 하지 않아도 괜찮아.

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams aren’t all that compel\na human to take their own life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간이 스스로의 목숨을 끊어 내게 만드는 건...\n애석하지만 꿈 하나가 아니기도 하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): And even if they are, I’ll still be certain\nof one thing. Wanna know what that is?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 설령 달나라의 오해가 진실로 밝혀진다 할지라도\n결코 바뀌지 않을 나의 생각이 하나 있는데, 들어 볼래?

English (United States)(en-US): Talking about my black always\nmakes my heart prickle...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 검정에 대한 이야기를 나누는 건\n언제나 마음을 까끌거리게 하지만...

English (United States)(en-US): But why not. I feel like\ntaking a chance this time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 왜인지 이번에는 괜찮을 것만 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, your black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야, 너의 검정은.

English (United States)(en-US): Well.....
You’ve heard of a palette?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 팔레트라는 것 알지?

English (United States)(en-US): A palette.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 팔레트.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, of course. It’s the plate\nhumans use to paint pictures.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그럼. 인간들이 그림을\n그릴 때 사용하는 물감 그릇.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you know what happens when\nyou mix all the colors on that palette?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 팔레트 속 모든 색을\n전부 섞으면 무엇이 되는 줄 알아?

English (United States)(en-US): To you, your black is a terrible imperfection.\nOne that trapped you since you were born.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 너의 검정은 끔찍한 결함,\n태어날 때부터 널 옭아매던 결핍이었지.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t begin to imagine the pain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 고통을 난 짐작조차 할 수 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): But, your black as I understood\nit in my world was this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다만, 내가 바라본 뭉치의\n검정은 이런 존재였어.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s who you are, made all the more\ndeeper with each lovable color.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 색이 켜켜이 혼합되어...\n새까맣게 깊어진 검정.

English (United States)(en-US): A black of possibility that\ncan bloom any color.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 색이든 피워 낼 수 있는 가능성의 검정.

English (United States)(en-US): A black of possibility that\ncan bloom any color?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 색이든 피워 낼 수 있는 가능성의 검정?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, black that can bloom any color.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그리고 너의 사랑스러운 정체성.

English (United States)(en-US): ... But.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 그렇지만.

English (United States)(en-US): What use is possibility on\nits own? It’s only black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가능성으로만 머무른다면 무슨\n소용이야? 그저 검정일 뿐이잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): No, it’s black and that’s great!|Well, black is more than nothing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, ‘무려’ 검정인 거지!|검정은 아무것도 아니지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Because colors stay under\nthe surface of black,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검정은 역설적으로 색들이\n그의 물밑에서만 머물러 있기에

English (United States)(en-US): it ironically is free to be black with\nno compromise, boundaries or rules.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 타협 없이, 틀 없이, 멋대로\n자유롭게 시커먼 암흑일 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): A shade that can hide anything.\nA vast and silent embrace.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇이든 숨겨 줄 수 있는 색.\n넓고 고요한 품의 색.

English (United States)(en-US): Because black exists in its virtual state,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검정은 역설적으로, 색들이\n그의 물밑에서만 머물러 있기에

English (United States)(en-US): it ironically is free to be itself with\nno compromise, boundaries or rules.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 타협 없이, 틀 없이, 멋대로\n자유롭게 시커먼 암흑일 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): A shade that contains nothing,\nand so can welcome everything.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무것도 없기에, 모든 걸 담을 수 있는 색.

English (United States)(en-US): So I don’t want to lose\nyour black to colors.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 난 색채에게, 너의\n검정만큼은 빼앗기고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): True, you’ve always surprised me\nwith your multicolored imagination.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물론 넌 정말 다채로운 색색깔의\n상상으로 언제나 날 놀라게 했지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But if you were to one day bloom blue,\nI would be sorely disappointed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 몸에 어느 날 시퍼런 물감이\n자라났다면 난 아주 아쉬웠을걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Some things are beautiful because\nthey are black, solely black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검기에, 오로지 검기에만 아름다운 것들도 있으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Meaningless,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무의미하기에

English (United States)(en-US): thus free to have meaning.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자유롭게 의미를 붙일 수 있는 색.

English (United States)(en-US): Worthless,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무가치하기에

English (United States)(en-US): thus free to be of worth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자유롭게 가치를 부여할 수 있는 색.

English (United States)(en-US): That’s right.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지.

English (United States)(en-US): Does my black deserve the same logic?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무의미함을 바라보던 나의 논리를...

English (United States)(en-US): Does it really?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 나의 검정에게도 적용할 수 있는 거야? 정말?

English (United States)(en-US): My oldest, worst enemy... my black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 가장 오래되고 끔찍한 적...\n나의 검정에게도

English (United States)(en-US): Does it deserve to be set free?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자유로울 가치가 있는 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Of course. Of course it does.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼, 당연하지. 당연하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Why on earth not?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말이지 왜 안 돼?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh. Oh. <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아. 아아. <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검정.

English (United States)(en-US): My black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 검정.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I’m just getting used to it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 그래, 어색하지만.

English (United States)(en-US): A little acceptance,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조금은 인정하는 마음으로,

English (United States)(en-US): and a little pity,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조금은 연민하는 마음으로,

English (United States)(en-US): and a noisy yet silent gaze.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시끄럽지만 고요한 시선으로,

English (United States)(en-US): It’s very strange to gather all of\nthese and look down at my black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 검정을 내려다볼 수\n있다는 건 참으로 이상한 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Is there a word for these\nsilent, contracting emotions?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 고요하게 우그러드는 감각에게도\n할당된 단어가 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): How strange to have crash-landed\nhere and met you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이곳에 불시착해 너를 만난 것도 참으로 이상하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Strange... strange.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이상하고... 이상하고

English (United States)(en-US): And so beautiful it brings\ntears to my eyeballs.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈알 표면이 찡해지게 아름다워.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Dot, do you have to go?|Will I never see you again?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 뭉치, 조금만 더 오래 있어 주면 안 될까?|아직 작별하고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s not like you have to leave today.\nYou don’t have to be my dream straight away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꼭 오늘 떠나야 하는 건 아니야.\n당장 나의 꿈이 되지 않아도 되잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Couldn’t you stay with me until the end,\nand say goodbye only at its very end?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마지막의 마지막까지 함께하다\n작별하면 안 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): So you’ve noticed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈치챘구나.

English (United States)(en-US): We’ve truly reached the end of the end.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 정말 끝의 끝이지.

English (United States)(en-US): But I don’t want to scatter helplessly\njust because my time is up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 나는 시간이 다 되었다는 이유로\n무력하게 흩어지고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): And I don’t want you to remember\nme helpless and terrified.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 무력함이 나의 마지막 모습으로서\n각인되는 것도 원하지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): As human friends say goodbye, I want to\nmake a goodbye just for you and me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간 친구들이 작별하듯,\n직접 너와 나만의 작별을 만들고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): I want to push my heavy emotions down,\nand summon the will to say a joyful goodbye.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 질긴 감정을 꾹꾹 눌러 담고, 그보다 강한\n의지로 행복을 담아 작별하고 싶은걸.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought you might say that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 뭉치다운 마음이네.

English (United States)(en-US): (And so there was\nnothing more to be said.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그렇기에 더는 아무 말도 할 수 없었다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Don’t worry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 걱정하지 마.

English (United States)(en-US): You won’t see me anywhere, but\nyou might find me everywhere.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 나를 어디에서도 볼 수 없게 되겠지만,\n그렇기 때문에 어디에서나 보게 될지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): And we’ll meet again\nwhen I become a dream!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇보다 우리, 꿈이 되어 한 번 더 만날 거잖아!

English (United States)(en-US): I’m not sure when, or\nwhat dream I’ll end up as...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언제, 어느 날에, 어떤 꿈으로\n나타날지는 나도 잘 알 수 없지만...

English (United States)(en-US): But you’ll recognize me. Right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 알아봐 줄 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): Hehe. Let’s hope I won’t be your nightmare.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 헤헤. 너의 악몽만은 아니었으면 좋겠다.

English (United States)(en-US): What’s wrong with a nightmare?|You could never be my nightmare.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 악몽이면 어때?|결코 악몽은 아닐 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): No matter how horrible, damp, and eerie,\nI’ll take shelter in that nightmare and light a candle.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 끔찍하고, 축축하고, 섬뜩할지언정, 나는 그\n악몽을 본거지 삼고 텐트를 친 다음 촛불을 켤 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’d recognize you in a heartbeat,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 나는 단박에 너를 알아볼 테고,

English (United States)(en-US): and that would make it\na fine, beautiful nightmare.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 그런 대로 괜찮고 아름다운 악몽일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Even if it’s horrible, damp, and eerie,\nI’ll take shelter in that nightmare and light a candle.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 설령 끔찍하고, 축축하고, 섬뜩할지언정, 나는 그\n악몽을 본거지 삼고 텐트를 친 다음 촛불을 켤 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): You taught me how to\nfind peace in the pitch black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 넌 나에게 칠흑 같은 어둠 속에서도\n안락해지는 법을 알려 줬잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): So how could the final story you\nshare with me ever be a nightmare?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 네가 들려 주는 마지막 이야기가\n어떻게 악몽일 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>......
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>......

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, you really are right.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 정말 그렇네.

English (United States)(en-US): My pitch-black, round monster friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 새까맣고 동그란 괴물 친구.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you for taking your place\nin that dusty corner of my room.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 먼지만 쌓여 있던 내 방 구석진\n모퉁이에 찾아와 줘서 고마웠어.

English (United States)(en-US): If I’m ever scared or dizzy... I may stumble\nback into our memories etched in the past.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 아마... 불시에 두렵고 어지러워질 때마다, 과거에\n각인된 우리의 추억 속으로 뒷걸음질칠지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): When my room gets dark, when the sunlight\nhurts, when my emotions weigh me down.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 방 안이 유독 춥고 깜깜할 때, 햇살이 따갑고 피로하게\n느껴질 때, 내 안의 감정들이 기어코 버거워졌을 때.

English (United States)(en-US): When you feel like paddling in the dark.\nWhen the dark threatens to choke you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 암흑 속에서 물장구치고 싶을 때.\n암흑에 질식할 것 같을 때에도.

English (United States)(en-US): But you’ll find the smallest sliver of strength\nin the times we spent together.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만 넌 그 추억 속에서\n실낱 같은 힘을 되찾을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Yes. A strength only made\nstronger because I met you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 응, 너를 만났기에 더욱 선명해졌을 힘을.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be afraid, but I won’t stop.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 두려워하면서도 멈추지 않을게.

English (United States)(en-US): Just like you in the pitch black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 암흑 속에서 몸소 그러했듯이.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Yes. Thank you for everything.
I wonder what our friendship will\nlook like when you look back?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때의 네가 뒤돌아본 우리의\n우정은 어떤 모습을 하고 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll tell you all about it.\nWhen we see each other again.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나중에 만나게 되면 다 이야기해 줄게. 전부.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve decided to take a chance\non my ‘black’ and its possibilities.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나, 이번에는 내가 가진 ‘검정’의 가능성을 믿어 볼래.

English (United States)(en-US): You’ve cherished it this whole time. So I’ll\nlook forward to what you’ll etch on my black...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 줄곧 아껴 주었던 것이니까. 나의 검정에\n아로새겨질 너만의 의미를 기대하며...

English (United States)(en-US): And become your black dream.\nA thick, certain shade of black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 검은 꿈이 될게.\n농도 짙고 확연한 검정이 되어,

English (United States)(en-US): And I’ll paint one of your nights
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 어느 밤을

English (United States)(en-US): with the safest swirling darkness.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가장 안전하고 자유롭게\n휘몰아치는 암흑으로 물들일게.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll become a black dream!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검은 꿈이 될게.

English (United States)(en-US): Your black black dream...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 검고 검은 꿈이...

English (United States)(en-US): Now close your eyes, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 눈을 감아, <nickname>.
